<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>In exciting <a href="https://www.axios.com/cdc-guidance-vaccinated-people-6765f100-683e-4a78-8e2c-1b573c5683b8.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new guidelines</a> released yesterday, the CDC said that people who've been fully vaccinated against Covid-19 can gather indoors with other fully vaccinated people sans masks (but they should still mask up when in public).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Also, vaccinated grandparents can socialize without distancing or masks with their healthy children or grandchildren. Time to unleash that hug you've been prepping for a year.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/08/cathie-wood-ark-innovation-off-tough-start-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There Might Be a Hole in the Ark
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An ark sinking with Ark Investment's logo on the side" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzM4L3NpbmtpbmdfYXJrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unless you can see the future like the Three-Eyed Raven, chances are the last month has turned your brokerage account into an all-red Jackson Pollock painting. Tech stocks that defied gravity for the majority of the pandemic have been hit the hardest, knocking the Nasdaq to 11% below its record yesterday. And that's impacted one all-star stock picker more than most: Founder, CEO, and Chief Investment Officer of Ark Investments Cathie Wood. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ark's five exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have all dropped </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/cathie-woods-ark-faces-test-as-tech-rally-cools-11615208809?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over 20%</a></span><span> since early February, and its flagship fund, Ark Innovation, has declined for three weeks in a row.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory</strong>: Wood's philosophy is to invest in companies that are developing paradigm-changing technologies. Which means Ark has huge positions in companies, including Tesla, Square, and Roku, that absolutely crushed it last year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2020, Ark Innovation became the largest actively managed ETF in the world, with $17 billion in assets under management. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ark's flagship fund returned </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/19/cathie-wood-markets-new-oracle?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 150%</a></span><span>, and its other actively managed ETFs all at least doubled in value.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But it's not 2020 anymore</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">139 of the 164 stocks held across Ark's five funds are down over the past month. That level of underperformance has shaken investors' confidence in Wood—Ark experienced more than <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/cathie-woods-ark-investment-faces-reckoning-as-tech-trade-stalls-11614853810?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1.8 billion in outflows</a> between February 24 and March 1, its heftiest stretch of losses ever. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Rising bond yields, fears of inflation, and a "return to normal" have been spooking tech investors this spring. And Ark is particularly sensitive to any moves away from higher-risk tech stocks because it has so much exposure to them.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">One example:</strong></span><span> Tesla accounts for around 10% of Ark Innovation. That position made Wood look like a genius when Tesla gained almost 8x last year, but stocks don't always go up. Tesla has lost </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-tesla-graphic/tesla-loses-a-third-of-its-value-for-the-third-time-in-a-year-idUSKBN2B02FN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a third of its value</a></span><span> since hitting an all-time high in January.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Following its otherworldly 2020, any dip in Ark's performance was going to set off alarm bells. But after another brutal day yesterday (Ark Innovation dropped nearly 6%), skeptics are on the prowl—short interest in Ark Innovation rose to its highest level ever last Thursday.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/08/stimulus-update-house-expected-pass-bill-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jobs on the Rebound
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, the House is expected to clear the final legislative hurdle before President Biden can sign his $1.9 trillion stimulus plan. Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen got an early start on the victory lap with one especially exciting <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-coronavirus-pandemic-inflation-janet-yellen-economy-2d8fb02fba7115e2af5379ec7014df26?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prediction</a>: a return to "full employment" in 2022.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What's that?</strong></span><span> When everyone who is able and willing to work has a job. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yellen is still soothing concerns that more stimulus will lead to inflation. "We had a 3.5% unemployment rate before the pandemic and there was no sign of inflation increasing," she told MSNBC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Goldman Sachs is also feeling optimistic about the job market, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/08/goldman-sachs-forecasts-a-jobs-boom-says-unemployment-rate-could-fall-to-4point1percent-by-the-end-of-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicting</a> 4.1% unemployment by the end of 2021 thanks to government stimulus and improvements in leisure/hospitality. For context, overall unemployment hit a record 14.8% last April. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Also yesterday, Yellen <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-treasury-yellen-women/yellen-says-covid-19-having-extremely-unfair-impact-on-womens-income-jobs-idUSKBN2B01UP?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">discussed</a> the need for more reforms like paid family leave and improved child care to boost women’s employment. In the US, 2.5 million women left the labor force between February 2020 and January 2021, compared to 1.8 million men. </p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/08/north-american-box-office-best-pandemic-weekend?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
US Box Office Slowly Wakes Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/08/north-american-box-office-best-pandemic-weekend" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of animated Minions sitting in a row at a movie theater cheering" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=381 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11NcpG5wIIp77W/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of animated Minions sitting in a row at a movie theater cheering" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11NcpG5wIIp77W/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the weekend, the North American box office pulled in an estimated $24 million, its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/08/as-the-box-office-inches-towards-recovery-studios-move-up-major-titles.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best haul</a> during Covid but a long way from $101+ million the same weekend last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's helping:</strong> With 45% of theaters now open, this was the first "normal" weekend since the pandemic started, per Comscore analyst Paul Dergarabedian. Last week, NYC and San Francisco <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/04/nyc-san-francisco-reopen-theaters-25-capacity?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reopened</a> theaters with limited capacity.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's hurting: </strong><em>Raya and the Last Dragon</em> and <em>Tom & Jerry</em> were 1) the biggest debuts and 2) <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/07/business/box-office-hollywood-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also released</a> on Disney+ and HBO Max, respectively. Both streaming platforms will continue to exclusively or simultaneously premiere films this year, keeping some people glued to their couches.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Slow and steady </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Studios are betting that vaccinated consumers will want to head back to theaters. After a year with every release being pushed back, some studios are finally moving premieres up, including <em>Godzilla v. Kong</em> (now scheduled for March 31) and <em>A Quiet Place II</em> (May 28). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, the return is uneven. Universal just <a href="https://deadline.com/2021/03/f9-minions-the-rise-of-gru-universal-release-date-change-1234706609/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delayed</a> its newest <em>Fast and Furious</em> film again from May to June while it waits for more international markets to reopen. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"There is nothing tastier or prettier than the combination of burritos and makeup!"</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kory Marchisotto, chief marketing officer of E.l.f. Beauty, stated the obvious when discussing his company's <a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/retail-therapy-elf-cosmetics-taps-chipotle-for-its-latest-drop/596214/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">co-branded collection</a> with Chipotle. The limited-edition makeup collection, which drops today, features an eyeshadow palette inspired by Chipotle ingredients (like pinto beans) and an avocado-shaped makeup sponge.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The $4 billion in pandemic relief donated by MacKenzie Scott accounted for <a href="https://candid.org/about/press-room/releases/new-report-finds-that-more-than-20-billion-went-to-covid-19-philanthropy-in-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost 75%</a> of all Covid-related giving by high-net-worth individuals, according to a recent report from Candid and the Center for Disaster Philanthropy.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/08/discord-keeps-pandemic-momentum-going?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Guess the Company
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Helga from "Hey Arnold" saying "It's a mystery"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUNd9XfltRREDbvwBO/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Helga from " Hey Arnold" saying "It's a mystery"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUNd9XfltRREDbvwBO/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The WSJ dropped some <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-social-network-without-ads-discord-defies-convention-11615199401?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">juicy new numbers</a> on a fast-growing company yesterday. Do you know what it is?</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Revenue increased to $130 million in 2020 from $45 million in 2019</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It doubled its monthly user base to ~140 million</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was valued at $7 billion in December after raising $100 million</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're better at writing newsletters than we are at keeping secrets so we'll tell you: It's Discord, the social network startup that has exploded in popularity during the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Started in 2015 as a place for friends to chat while playing video games, Discord has <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/02/discords-35-billion-valuation-begs-question?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grown</a> into a platform for more communities to connect. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For instance, there's a 400+ person Discord server called Parrot's Nest, which provides a forum for parrot owners.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it makes money:</strong> Discord doesn't run ads like other social media companies. Instead, the free-to-use platform relies on subscription revenue from users who pay more for special perks like emojis or enhanced video resolution.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Discord is a force in the amateur investing community. After the original Wall Street Bets Discord server <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/1/27/22253251/discord-bans-the-r-wallstreetbets-server?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was banned</a> for hate speech during the height of meme stock mania in January, the new server has already amassed over 592,000 members. </p>

GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Just How Big Is Texas?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everything’s bigger in Texas—that’s indisputable. But today, we ask you: What’s bigger <em>than </em>Texas. Below you’ll find several countries/territories around the world; you have to decide whether they’re bigger or smaller in area than Texas.</p>

Banks, industrials, and travel-related stocks \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/nasdaq-hits-correction-dow-advances-as-stimulus-bill-nears-finish-line-idUSKBN2B00YH?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinue to gain\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e while tech continues to flop.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStimulus: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Biden administration said that a “large number” of Americans should receive another round of relief payments by the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/white-house-expects-many-americans-to-get-stimulus-checks-by-end-of-the-month-11615237221?mod=home-page\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eend of the month\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Those checks are part of the $1.9 trillion Senate-approved stimulus plan the House may vote on as soon as style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nINVESTING\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/08/cathie-wood-ark-innovation-off-tough-start-2021?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThere Might Be a Hole in the Ark\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An ark sinking with Ark Investment's logo on the side\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzM4L3NpbmtpbmdfYXJrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnless you can see the future like the Three-Eyed Raven, chances are the last month has turned your brokerage account into an all-red Jackson Pollock painting. Tech stocks that defied gravity for the majority of the pandemic have been hit the hardest, knocking the Nasdaq to 11% below its record yesterday. And that's impacted one all-star stock picker more than most: Founder, CEO, and Chief Investment Officer of Ark Investments Cathie Wood. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eArk's five exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have all dropped \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/cathie-woods-ark-faces-test-as-tech-rally-cools-11615208809?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover 20%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since early February, and its flagship fund, Ark Innovation, has declined for three weeks in a row.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory\u003c/strong\u003e: Wood's philosophy is to invest in companies that are developing paradigm-changing technologies. Which means Ark has huge positions in companies, including Tesla, Square, and Roku, that absolutely crushed it last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2020, Ark Innovation became the largest actively managed ETF in the world, with $17 billion in assets under management. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eArk's flagship fund returned \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/19/cathie-wood-markets-new-oracle?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than 150%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and its other actively managed ETFs all at least doubled in value.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut it's not 2020 anymore\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e139 of the 164 stocks held across Ark's five funds are down over the past month. That level of underperformance has shaken investors' confidence in Wood—Ark experienced more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/cathie-woods-ark-investment-faces-reckoning-as-tech-trade-stalls-11614853810?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1.8 billion in outflows\u003c/a\u003e between February 24 and March 1, its heftiest stretch of losses ever. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eRising bond yields, fears of inflation, and a \"return to normal\" have been spooking tech investors this spring. And Ark is particularly sensitive to any moves away from higher-risk tech stocks because it has so much exposure to them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne example:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Tesla accounts for around 10% of Ark Innovation. That position made Wood look like a genius when Tesla gained almost 8x last year, but stocks don't always go up. Tesla has lost \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-tesla-graphic/tesla-loses-a-third-of-its-value-for-the-third-time-in-a-year-idUSKBN2B02FN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea third of its value\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since hitting an all-time high in January.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Following its otherworldly 2020, any dip in Ark's performance was going to set off alarm bells. But after another brutal day yesterday (Ark Innovation dropped nearly 6%), skeptics are on the prowl—short interest in Ark Innovation rose to its highest level ever last Rebound\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, the House is expected to clear the final legislative hurdle before President Biden can sign his $1.9 trillion stimulus plan. Treasury Sec. Janet Yellen got an early start on the victory lap with one especially exciting \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-coronavirus-pandemic-inflation-janet-yellen-economy-2d8fb02fba7115e2af5379ec7014df26?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprediction\u003c/a\u003e: a return to \"full employment\" in 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's that?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e When everyone who is able and willing to work has a job. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYellen is still soothing concerns that more stimulus will lead to inflation. \"We had a 3.5% unemployment rate before the pandemic and there was no sign of inflation increasing,\" she told MSNBC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoldman Sachs is also feeling optimistic about the job market, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/08/goldman-sachs-forecasts-a-jobs-boom-says-unemployment-rate-could-fall-to-4point1percent-by-the-end-of-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicting\u003c/a\u003e 4.1% unemployment by the end of 2021 thanks to government stimulus and improvements in leisure/hospitality. For context, overall unemployment hit a record 14.8% last April. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Also yesterday, Yellen \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-treasury-yellen-women/yellen-says-covid-19-having-extremely-unfair-impact-on-womens-income-jobs-idUSKBN2B01UP?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediscussed\u003c/a\u003e the need for more reforms like paid family leave and improved child care to boost women’s employment. In the US, 2.5 million women left the labor force between February 2020 and January 2021, compared to 1.8 million men. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the weekend, the North American box office pulled in an estimated $24 million, its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/08/as-the-box-office-inches-towards-recovery-studios-move-up-major-titles.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest haul\u003c/a\u003e during Covid but a long way from $101+ million the same weekend last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's helping:\u003c/strong\u003e With 45% of theaters now open, this was the first \"normal\" weekend since the pandemic started, per Comscore analyst Paul Dergarabedian. Last week, NYC and San Francisco \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/04/nyc-san-francisco-reopen-theaters-25-capacity?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereopened\u003c/a\u003e theaters with limited capacity.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's hurting: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003eRaya and the Last Dragon\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eTom \u0026 Jerry\u003c/em\u003e were 1) the biggest debuts and 2) \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/07/business/box-office-hollywood-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso released\u003c/a\u003e on Disney+ and HBO Max, respectively. Both streaming platforms will continue to exclusively or simultaneously premiere films this year, keeping some people glued to their couches.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSlow and steady \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStudios are betting that vaccinated consumers will want to head back to theaters. After a year with every release being pushed back, some studios are finally moving premieres up, including \u003cem\u003eGodzilla v. Kong\u003c/em\u003e (now scheduled for March 31) and \u003cem\u003eA Quiet Place II\u003c/em\u003e (May 28). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, the return is uneven. Universal just \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2021/03/f9-minions-the-rise-of-gru-universal-release-date-change-1234706609/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelayed\u003c/a\u003e its newest \u003cem\u003eFast and Furious\u003c/em\u003e film again from May to style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejuicy new numbers\u003c/a\u003e on a fast-growing company yesterday. Do you know what it is?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRevenue increased to $130 million in 2020 from $45 million in 2019\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt doubled its monthly user base to ~140 million\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt was valued at $7 billion in December after raising $100 million\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe're better at writing newsletters than we are at keeping secrets so we'll tell you: It's Discord, the social network startup that has exploded in popularity during the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStarted in 2015 as a place for friends to chat while playing video games, Discord has \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/02/discords-35-billion-valuation-begs-question?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrown\u003c/a\u003e into a platform for more communities to connect. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor instance, there's a 400+ person Discord server called Parrot's Nest, which provides a forum for parrot owners.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it makes money:\u003c/strong\u003e Discord doesn't run ads like other social media companies. Instead, the free-to-use platform relies on subscription revenue from users who pay more for special perks like emojis or enhanced video resolution.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eDiscord is a force in the amateur investing community. After the original Wall Street Bets Discord server \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/1/27/22253251/discord-bans-the-r-wallstreetbets-server?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas banned\u003c/a\u003e for hate speech during the height of meme stock mania in January, the new server has already amassed over 592,000 members. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
